item.title: Under pressure!? Reform Stress In The Public Sector
item.description: Public organizations are subject to a multitude of reforms. Yet, little is known on the precise effects of such continuous reforms. This research analyses the effect of such repeated structural reforms on the entrepreneurial nature of public sector organizations. During the last decades, the public sector has witnessed wave after wave of structural reforms. Yet, this ‘reform fever’ has rarely resulted in desirable outcomes. Although to date little is known on how those repeated reforms precisely affect public sector organizations (PSOs), literature has advanced the notion that such repeated reforms can lead to reform stress (Pollitt, 2007).
